metadata.title: CVE-2024-42094 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/iucv: Avoid explicit cpumask var allocation on stackFor CONFIG_CPUMASK_OFFSTACK=y kernel, explicit allocation of cpumaskvariable on stack is not recommended since it can cause potential stackoverflow.Instead, kernel code should always use *cpumask_var API(s) to allocatecpumask var in config-neutral way, leaving allocation strategy toCONFIG_CPUMASK_OFFSTACK.Use *cpumask_var API(s) to address it.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-aws package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
